summary: Email correspondence between a federal prosecutor and attorney Gary Stein regarding a subpoena for records from the Professional Children's School related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial transactions, specifically tuition payments, third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships from 1997 to 2000.

persons.name: Gary Stein
persons.role: Partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP
persons.context: Attorney who is being contacted by a federal prosecutor regarding records from the Professional Children's School related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial transactions.

persons.name: Elizabeth Sullivan
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence between the prosecutor and Gary Stein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inquiry seeks records of his tuition payments, third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships at the Professional Children's School from 1997 to 2000.

connections.description: Stein is being contacted by a prosecutor regarding financial records related to Epstein, suggesting he may have legal or institutional knowledge about records pertaining to Epstein.

events.title: Email inquiry about Epstein school records
events.description: A federal prosecutor emails attorney Gary Stein to inquire about the availability of records from the Professional Children's School related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial transactions from 1997 to 2000.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was investigating Jeffrey Epstein's financial transactions with the Professional Children's School as of February 2020.
The investigation sought records of tuition payments, third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships from 1997 to 2000.
A previous subpoena had been issued for student financial records, and the prosecutor was inquiring if an updated subpoena was needed for third-party payment records.
